channel.title: java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: EGUI
channel.description:
Whenever I run a client, any client, I get the error -
exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: EGUI
Please help guys, it's pissing me off..

item.title: java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: EGUI
item.dc:creator: @quest_rs quest rs
item.description:
@quest_rs wrote:

[quote=“getsome, post:9, topic:119228”][quote author=quest rs link=topic=168658.msg1567551#msg1567551 date=1183524470]
ah, ops I forgot one part in that :P.

Anyways, It cant find the client background/cache
[/quote]see iw as right you dooch[/quote]

  1. no he needed to set paths, not “update java”
  2. I see your parents didn’t teach you any manners; Pretty immature of you.

3.not sure whats wrong that :)… Can’t really help without clear details regarding your computer configurations and settings or client details.

item.title: java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: EGUI
item.dc:creator: @NexondotNet NexondotNet
item.description:
@NexondotNet wrote:

Lol, the client loads alright, but when it says “Loading Title Screen”, it pauses and then says “Connection Error… Retrying in 5…4…3.2…” Then it says “Loacing Title Screen” again and it keeps repeating.

I did this after xxl3th4lxx’s tutorial up there ^

Read full topic

item.title: java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: EGUI
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

you have to either download and install JDK 6u1 (Java developing kit 6.0 update 1)

you need to add the varibles.
click start–>right click my computer–> click properties.

then click “Environment Variables”
then a window should pop up. Click “classpath” and then click edit.

change “Varible Value” to

.;C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_01\bin\;C:\Program Files\Java\jre1.6.0\lib\ext\QTJava.zip;C:\Program Files\Java\jre1.6.0_01\lib\ext\QTJava.zip

ok and then click Ok

Then scroll down click “PATH” (if it is “path” change it to “PATH”) and click edit again and change “Varible Value” to

C:\Program Files\PHP\;C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0\bin\;C:\Program Files\QuickTime\QTSystem\;

then click Ok and then again and again.
All done!
Remember this only works for the JDK 6u1 version of Java.
Hope this helps!

Read full topic
